intro: Randia homblei, commonly known as the Hawaiian randia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Randia homblei is often found in conservation areas due to its limited distribution and ecological significance.
